The first computer bug was an actual bug! In 1947, a moth got stuck in a Harvard computer.
JavaScript was created in just 10 days by Brendan Eich in 1995.
The term 'debugging' was coined by Grace Hopper after finding that moth.
Python was named after Monty Python, not the snake!
The first website ever is still online at info.cern.ch
Git was created by Linus Torvalds (creator of Linux) in just 2 weeks.
The '404 Not Found' error comes from room 404 at CERN where the web was born.
Ada Lovelace wrote the first computer algorithm in 1843, before computers existed!
The first programming language was Fortran, created in 1957.
The average developer spends 50% of their time debugging.
Stack Overflow was launched in 2008 and has over 23 million questions.
The first computer mouse was made of wood!
The term 'spam' comes from a Monty Python sketch.
HTML5 was finalized 15 years after HTML4 (1999 to 2014).
The first domain name ever registered was symbolics.com in 1985.
CSS was proposed in 1994 but took until 1996 to become a standard.
The @ symbol in email was chosen because it was rarely used.
The first webcam was created to monitor a coffee pot at Cambridge University.
JavaScript has nothing to do with Java - it was named for marketing purposes!
The original storage capacity of an iPhone (4GB) now fits in your RAM.
Vim was released in 1991 and people still argue about how to exit it!
React was initially developed for Facebook's News Feed in 2011.
The term 'algorithm' comes from the 9th-century mathematician Al-Khwarizmi.
The first computer programmer was Ada Lovelace, a woman, in the 1840s.
More code is deleted than written - about 10 lines deleted for every 1 added.
